p: It is estimated that 185 million people are infected with HCV globally [23]. Infected individuals have a 75–85% likelihood of developing chronic infection, which when left untreated can lead to liver cirrhosis and hepatocarcinoma [24]. Previous to 2011 [when the first direct-acting antivirals (DAAs) were released into the market], pegylated interferon (IFN)-α combined with ribavirin was used as a standard therapy, with aviraemia 24 weeks after completion of antiviral therapy of 40–80%, depending on viral genotype [25].
